pr_title: [#9382] Refactor instructor feedback session deleted table

timeline.message: Refactor recycle bin table to another component
Refactor recycle bin completely to component
Add documentation to required component files

timeline.bodyText: It is not a good practice to change the @Input property in the child component. I leave you to figure out the reason.
timeline.author: xpdavid
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,71 @@ +
+
+

+ Deleted Feedback Sessions +

+
+

replies.bodyText:
Could the reason be that we want the child component to have a more predictable behaviour? Because if we let the child change the input property, the parent component will not have control over how the child will behave which is not ideal.
Anyway, have made the change to have the click emit an event which parent component can subscribe to instead.
replies.author: t-cheepeng

replies.bodyText:
Could the reason be that we want the child component to have a more predictable behaviour? Because if we let the child change the input property, the parent component will not have control over how the child will behave which is not ideal.

Exactly. However, this does not mean all logic should go to parent component. The child components can still make changes by using event (then the control becomes the parent component, either subscribe it or ignore it).
For example, in this case, if want to keep you toggle logic, you can first isRecycleBinExpandedChange event inside the child component.
replies.author: xpdavid

timeline.message: Make recycle bin table emit event for expansion
